title.narrative: Ghana Landscape Restoration and Small Scale Mining Project

description.narrative: to strengthen integrated natural resource management and increase benefits to communities in targeted savannah and cocoa forest landscapes

activity-date.narrative: Actual end date of the activity
Actual start date of the activity
Planned end date of the activity
Planned start date of the activity

mailing-address.narrative: The World Bank, 1818 H Street, NW, Washington, DC 20433 USA

title.narrative: Management effectiveness according to METT score in target Protected areas (score, disaggregated): Gbele Resource Reserve, Mole National Park, Digya National Park
Gold purchase agents adopting gold trading tracking tool
CREMA Executive Committees established with project support that have at least four women (gender indicator)
CWMTs established with project support that have at least one woman (gender indicator)
Area under PES in production landscapes
Nationals trained in extractive industries skills (gender indicator)
Area under sustainable forest management as a result of the project (in FRs and wildlife PAs)
Government institutions provided with capacity-building support to improve management of natural resources
Areas for which land use planning has been undertaken under spatial sub-basin plans
Government counterparts participating in global, national and regional forums and workshops
Trees in production landscapes outside of forests
Functional infrastructure supported by the project
People in targeted areas with increased benefits as a result of the project (citizen engagement indicator)
Area under plantations and re-/afforestation – reforestation in FRs and buffer zones
Women participating in decision making processes through membership in District Management and Planning Committees (gender indicator)
Planning tool/s developed and used for spatial planning and monitoring
Targeted landscapes where planning for mining incorporates nature-based solution to mitigate negative environmental impacts
Land users adopting new practices in targeted landscapes
People participating in consultations / decision-making on natural resources management (citizen engagement indicator)
Area under improved catchment management (riparian vegetation)
Communities with endorsed micro watershed management plans consistent with the sub-basin plans and under implementation
Partnerships with actors along the sustainable value chain
Minerals Commission district and satellite offices refurbished
Forest area brought under management plans
Formal categories of mineral license types available for registration
Area under collaborative, integrated and innovative management and with improved climate resilience (CREMAs) (climate indicator)
Land area under sustainable landscape management practices
Forested land area under sustainable forest management practices (climate indicator)
Environmental and social management system for ASM established and operational
Project M&E system providing required reports and data in a timely manner
Reforms in forest policy, legislation, or other regulations supported
